svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - March 16 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 16, 2024" date: "2024-03-16"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
• Mainnet successfully upgraded to Dencun Consensus-specs v1.4.0 for Dencun mainnet release
Mainnet successfully upgraded to Dencun
• Consensus-specs v1.4.0 for Dencun mainnet release
• EIP4844 (blobs) Layer 2: L2 fees drop to cents & below: L2 Fees , Gas Fees & grow the pie L2s using
blobs: zkSync Era , Starknet , Optimism & Base , Zora, Mode , Arbitrum and Paradex L2Beat data
availability dashboard Dune blob dashboards: Hildobby and 0xRob View blobs on Blobscan & Etherscan
Finematics EIP4844 explainer Reminder: write a data blog post for EF EIP4844 data challenge

• Layer 2: L2 fees drop to cents & below: L2 Fees , Gas Fees & grow the pie L2s using blobs: zkSync
Era , Starknet , Optimism & Base , Zora, Mode , Arbitrum and Paradex L2Beat data availability
dashboard Dune blob dashboards: Hildobby and 0xRob

Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
• Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Pectra
upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles &
exposing operations Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to include): EIP3074
AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for EIP7547 inclusion lists : breakout call Monday
EIP7623 increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s EIP7645 alias ORIGIN to SENDER :
alternatively raise price
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
• Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress
precompiles & exposing operations Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to
include): EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for EIP7547 inclusion lists :
breakout call Monday EIP7623 increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s EIP7645 alias
ORIGIN to SENDER : alternatively raise price
• EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles & exposing operations
EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles & exposing operations
• Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to include): EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL
opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for EIP7547 inclusion lists : breakout call Monday EIP7623
increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s EIP7645 alias ORIGIN to SENDER :
Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to include):
• EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for
EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for
• EIP7547 inclusion lists : breakout call Monday
EIP7547 inclusion lists : breakout call Monday
• EIP7623 increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s
EIP7623 increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s
• EIP7645 alias ORIGIN to SENDER : alternatively raise price
EIP7645 alias ORIGIN to SENDER : alternatively raise price

EIP6110 supply validator deposits onchain explainer
• Case for inclusion lists (EIP7547) in Electra
Case for inclusion lists (EIP7547) in Electra
This newsletter is sponsored by Pashov Audit Group !
Are you developing a blockchain protocol? Make sure to get a high-quality audit. Audits are not silver
bullets, but a good one drastically decreases the chances of a successful attack. An “internal review”
by your developers is not an audit. Without a formal one many users won’t trust your protocol because
you are putting their funds at risk.
In Pashov Audit Group we know for a fact that we can help you secure your code in a painless,
high-quality and express manner. We are looking for established projects who invest in security and
are looking for the highest quality security partner.
We still have a couple of slots available over the next couple of months. Reach out for security help
- pashov.net
Osaka + F starname upgrade (meta EIP7607 )
• Verkle implementers call video & notes : Kaustinen-5 testnet soon DoS vector means clients need to
handle trie depth of 14-16
• Kaustinen-5 testnet soon
Kaustinen-5 testnet soon
• DoS vector means clients need to handle trie depth of 14-16
DoS vector means clients need to handle trie depth of 14-16
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
• 🚨 Lido at 30.81% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 30.81% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
• Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a
chain split Consensus layer: Prysm 38% , any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality Prysm
bug found on Goerli testnet highlights need for client diversity
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
• Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split
• Consensus layer: Prysm 38% , any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% , any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
• Prysm bug found on Goerli testnet highlights need for client diversity
Prysm bug found on Goerli testnet highlights need for client diversity
• Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
• Reth (Rust based execution layer client) now in beta
Reth (Rust based execution layer client) now in beta
• Grandine (Rust based consensus layer client), open sourced with GPL v3.0 license
Grandine (Rust based consensus layer client), open sourced with GPL v3.0 license
• Vitalik: quantum emergency upgrade plan to save most user funds
Vitalik: quantum emergency upgrade plan to save most user funds
Client Releases
• Consensus layer: Lighthouse v5.1.1 : hotfix Lodestar v1.17.0 : optimization update Prysm v5.0.1 :
minor patch release
Consensus layer:
• Lighthouse v5.1.1 : hotfix
Lighthouse v5.1.1 : hotfix
• Lodestar v1.17.0 : optimization update
Lodestar v1.17.0 : optimization update
• Prysm v5.0.1 : minor patch release
Prysm v5.0.1 : minor patch release
• Execution layer: Reth v0.2.0-beta.2 : resync required upgrading from alpha; v0.1.0-alpha.22 : bug
fix
Execution layer:
• Reth v0.2.0-beta.2 : resync required upgrading from alpha; v0.1.0-alpha.22 : bug fix
For Stakers
• Stereum v2.1 (node launcher): adds Obol support and SSV Network encrypted keys
Research
• Stake distribution analysis : change in issuance won’t change staking distribution
Stake distribution analysis : change in issuance won’t change staking distribution
• Data availability sampling strategies : lossy, incremental and diagonal sampling
Data availability sampling strategies : lossy, incremental and diagonal sampling
Layer 2
• Blast stopped producing blocks after mainnet Dencun upgrade, resolved
EIPs/Standards
• EIPs: EIP7650 : Programmable access lists
EIPs:
• EIP7650 : Programmable access lists
• ERCs (application layer): ERC7651 : Fractionally represented NFT ERC7652 : ERC721 guarantee
extension ERC7653 : Named NFT (ERC721 extension) ERC7654 : Request method types ERC7655 : ERC5189
operation receipts

• ERC7651 : Fractionally represented NFT
ERC7651 : Fractionally represented NFT

ERC7652 : ERC721 guarantee extension

ERC7653 : Named NFT (ERC721 extension)

ERC7654 : Request method types

ERC7655 : ERC5189 operation receipts
Stuff for developers
• Solidity v0.8.25 : Cancun default EVM version, MCOPY used in code generator and TSTORE usage
warnings reduced to once per compilation
Solidity v0.8.25 : Cancun default EVM version, MCOPY used in code generator and TSTORE usage warnings
reduced to once per compilation
• Remix v0.45.0 : pin deployed contracts, VM state is saved and fetch code for Blockscout verified
contracts
Remix v0.45.0 : pin deployed contracts, VM state is saved and fetch code for Blockscout verified
• Hardhat v2.22.1 : Hardhat Ignition default deployment system; v2.22.0 : Cancun default EVM version
for Hardhat Network
Hardhat v2.22.1 : Hardhat Ignition default deployment system; v2.22.0 : Cancun default EVM version for
Hardhat Network
• Ethernaut-cli (tool box): AI (requires OpenAI API key), utils, Hardhat tasks and Ethernaut
challenges; alpha
Ethernaut-cli (tool box): AI (requires OpenAI API key), utils, Hardhat tasks and Ethernaut challenges;
alpha
• Foundry: Forge-std v1.8.0 : uses native assertions, supports packed variables, adds TOML read/write
cheatcodes, native string manipulation cheatcodes and implements interfaces in mock tokens Tip:
console.log to debug a deployed contract using vm.etch on a fork
Foundry:
• Forge-std v1.8.0 : uses native assertions, supports packed variables, adds TOML read/write
cheatcodes, native string manipulation cheatcodes and implements interfaces in mock tokens
Forge-std v1.8.0 : uses native assertions, supports packed variables, adds TOML read/write cheatcodes,
native string manipulation cheatcodes and implements interfaces in mock tokens

Tip: console.log to debug a deployed contract using vm.etch on a fork
• Evm.codes adds Cancun opcodes
Evm.codes adds Cancun opcodes
• Tincho: solc skips code size check for external calls with return data, including precompiles
Tincho: solc skips code size check for external calls with return data, including precompiles
• web3py middleware (v7 beta): class-based middleware replaces functional programming paradigm
web3py middleware (v7 beta): class-based middleware replaces functional programming paradigm
• micro-eth-signer v0.8 : adds EIP4844 blob transaction support
micro-eth-signer v0.8 : adds EIP4844 blob transaction support

Curta CTF CurtaLending solution
• Node Guardians (gamified learning) adds Solidity & Huff quests
Node Guardians (gamified learning) adds Solidity & Huff quests

infrastructure testing Ephemery : use for testing validator setups

Security
• Unizen $2.1M exploit via external call vulnerability after contract upgrade
Unizen $2.1M exploit via external call vulnerability after contract upgrade

Mozaic $2M drained by malicious developer using private key
• Blastoff (yield aggregator) 150 ETH exploit on Blast

• EF Devcon Bangkok venue: Queen Sirikit National Convention Center
Job Listings
• Certora is hiring: Head of Product , SR-Rust , Compiler Developer , FV Wizard .
Certora is hiring: Head of Product , SR-Rust , Compiler Developer , FV Wizard .
• 🔥OpenZeppelin is hiring: Open Source Development Manager & Product Manager
🔥OpenZeppelin is hiring: Open Source Development Manager & Product Manager

Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
• Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 21.9 to 190.0 gwei, with 55.3 gwei average Zero net issuance
currently at 22.9 gwei 25k ETH net burn this week

ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
• Maker roadmap : phase 1 (mid year): launch new brand, stable & governance tokens, lockstake engine
and Spark SubDAO; phase 2: scale; phase 3; new L1; phase 4: end game
Maker roadmap : phase 1 (mid year): launch new brand, stable & governance tokens, lockstake engine and
Spark SubDAO; phase 2: scale; phase 3; new L1; phase 4: end game

Sterlingov was merely an early user
